thread.title: Washington beats USC, shows Steve Sarkisian was bad hire - College Football
thread.title_full: Washington beats USC, shows Steve Sarkisian was bad hire - College Football - SI.com

author: Pete Thamel
title: Washington beats USC, shows Steve Sarkisian was bad hire - College Football
text:
by Pete Thamel Twitter Email Posted: Fri Oct. 9, 2015 LOS ANGELES — Win Forever. That’s the catch phrase, ethos and inspirational book Pete Carroll left behind after his nine-year stint at USC ended in 2010. He resurrected the program back into college football’s elite and ever since USC has flailed in its attempts to chase those highs.
At the LA Coliseum on Thursday night, USC got another reminder of why it should have deviated from Uncle Pete’s coaching tree. As USC wheezed, sputtered and pre-snap retreated its way to a 17–12 loss to pedestrian Washington (3–2), the Trojan faithful saw up-close the coach they let slip away.
Chris Petersen, then at Boise State, interviewed for the USC job following the 2013 season. The USC brass dismissed Petersen as not dynamic enough and too unwilling to handle the media and booster obligations that go hand-in-hand with the biggest football job in Los Angeles.
